GoH.utilities¶

The utilities package provides a collection of functions used to prepare data for different analysis tasks. These are largely helper functions, but some can operate on their own.

Examples

>>> text = GoH.utilities.readfile( input_dir, filename)
>>> spelling_dictionary = GoH.utilities.create_spelling_dictionary( wordlists, directory )
GoH.utilities.create_spelling_dictionary(wordlists, directory)[source]¶

Compile a spelling dictionary. Compiles a spelling dictionary from one or multiple wordlist files. Returns results as a set.

References

GoH.utilities.readfile()

Parameters:
  • wordlists (list) – List of filenames for the wordlist files.
  • directory (str) – Location of the wordlist files.
Returns:

List of unique words in all the compiled lists.
Return type:

set
GoH.utilities.define_directories(prev, cycle, base_dir)[source]¶

Helper function for iterating through document cleaning. This function redefines the directory information for each round of cleaning.

Parameters:
  • prev (str) – Name of cycle that was just completed.
  • cycle (str) – Name of current cycle.
  • base_dir (str) – Root directory
Returns:

Dictionary with keys prev and cycle and values of the corresponding directory paths.
Return type:

dict
GoH.utilities.get_title(page_id)[source]¶

Extract year information from a page ids.

Note

File names must be structured as follows:

TITLEYYYYMMDD-V00-00-page0.txt

or:

TITLEYYYYMMDD-V00-00.pdf
Parameters:page_id (str) – Filename to parse, formatted according to the note.
Returns:Returns the title information from the page id.
Return type:str
GoH.utilities.get_year(page_id)[source]¶

Extract year information from a page ids.

Note

File names must be structured as follows:

TITLEYYYYMMDD-V00-00-page0.txt

or:

TITLEYYYYMMDD-V00-00.pdf
Parameters:page_id (str) – Filename to parse, format according to the note.
Returns:Returns the first four digits, which corresponds to the year of publication.
Return type:str
GoH.utilities.open_original_docs(pdf_dir, text_dir, filenames)[source]¶

Opens the PDF and TXT files for a list of page ids. Used to verify the content of files that report high error rates or unusual error information.

Parameters:
  • pdf_dir (str) – Path to directory with PDF files.
  • text_dir (str) – Path to directory with TXT files.
  • filenames (list) – List of filenames to open.
GoH.utilities.rate_per_doc(corpus_statistics)[source]¶

Gather a list of doc_id and error_rates.

References

Uses the data generated by GoH.reports.process_directory().

Note

Use GoH.reports.process_directory() before running stats_to_df

Parameters:corpus_statistics (dict) – List of dictionaries with the information about all of the files in a directory.
:param The corpus data should be formatted as follows:::
{
‘doc_id’: document, ‘num_tokens’: len(tokens), ‘num_unique_tokens’: len(set(tokens)), ‘num_errors’: error_total, ‘error_rate’: rate, ‘errors’: error_report

}

Returns:Returns a subset of the data in corpus_statistics, namely the doc_id and the error_rate. Formatted as below:
{
    'doc_id': 'TITLEYYYYMMDD-V00-00-page0.txt'
    'error_rate': .02
}
Return type:dict
GoH.utilities.readfile(input_dir, filename)[source]¶
Reads in file from directory and file name.
Returns the content of the file.

Usage:

>>> text = readfile(input_dir, filename)
Parameters:
  • input_dir (str) – Directory with the input file.
  • filename (str) – Name of file to be read.
Returns:

Returns the content of the file as a string.
Return type:

str
GoH.utilities.stats_to_df(corpus_statistics)[source]¶

Convert stats to dictionary. Convert dictionary of corpus statistics to a dataframe for computations.

Uses pandas.

References

Uses the data generated by GoH.reports.process_directory().

Note

Use GoH.reports.process_directory() before running stats_to_df

Parameters:corpus_statistics (dict) – List of dictionaries with the information about all of the files in a directory.
:param The corpus data should be formatted as follows:::
{
‘doc_id’: document, ‘num_tokens’: len(tokens), ‘num_unique_tokens’: len(set(tokens)), ‘num_errors’: error_total, ‘error_rate’: rate, ‘errors’: error_report

}

Returns:Returns a dataframe with the following columns:
`doc_id`
`error_rate`
`num_tokens`
`num_errors`
Return type:dataframe
GoH.utilities.strip_punct(text)[source]¶

Remove punctuation and numbers. Remove select punctuation marks and numbers from a text and replaces them with a space.

Non-permanent changes for evaluation purposes only.

Uses the re library.

Parameters:text (str) – Content to be evaluated.
Returns:Returns the content string without the following characters: 0-9,.!?$:;&”.
Return type:str
GoH.utilities.to_lower(tokens)[source]¶

Convert all tokens to lower case.

Parameters:tokens (list) – List of tokens generated using a tokenizer.
Returns:List of all tokens converted to lowercase.
Return type:list
GoH.utilities.tokenize_text(text, tokenizer='whitespace')[source]¶

Converts file content to a list of tokens.

Uses nltk.tokenize.regexp.WhitespaceTokenizer().

Parameters:
  • text (str) – Content to be tokenized.
  • tokenizer (str) – option of tokenizer. Current options are ‘whitespace’ and ‘word’.
Returns:

Returns a list of the tokens in the text, separated by white space.
Return type:

list
